name: vfs-for-git
description: Run a VFS for git command
author: Sander Aernouts

inputs.name: command
inputs.label: Command
inputs.helpMarkDown: The VFS for git command to run

inputs.name: projectId
inputs.label: Project
inputs.helpMarkDown: Project that contains the git repository you want to clone.

inputs.name: gitRepositoryId
inputs.label: Repository
inputs.helpMarkDown: Git repository you want to clone using VFS for git

inputs.name: enlistmentRootPath
inputs.label: Destination directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Directory where the git repository will be cloned to using VFS for git. Note that VFS for git uses a special folder structure for Enlistments (repositories cloned using VFS for git). The contents of your repository will be placed in a `/src` subfolder. For example `$(Build.SourcesDirectory)/src`.

inputs.name: outputVariable
inputs.label: Output Variable
inputs.helpMarkDown: The variable name to assign the location of where the git repository cloned with VFS for git is located.
